channel.description: The top News headlines from The Sydney Morning Herald. For all the news, visit https://www.smh.com.au
channel.title: Sydney Morning Herald - Latest News

item.dc:creator: Marissa Calligeros
item.description: If you suspect you or a family member has coronavirus you should call (not visit) your GP or ring the national Coronavirus Health Information Hotline on 1800 020 080.
item.title: Coronavirus updates LIVE: Global COVID-19 cases surpass 6.2 million as Australian death toll stands at 102

item.dc:creator: Mary Ward
item.description: George Floyd's death at the hands of Minneapolis police has sparked widespread riots in the United States with more than 40 cities in lockdown as demonstrators continue to clash with police.
item.title: George Floyd protests LIVE updates: US unrest ensues as Black Lives Matter demonstrators continue to clash with police

item.dc:creator: Fran Rimrod
item.description: A newly released survey shows almost 90 per cent of West Australians support interstate border closures – the highest level of support of any state as the number of active CVID-19 cases in WA rises to 29.
item.title: WA coronavirus LIVE: Most West Australians support state border closure as cases creep up again

item.description: Companies are under increasing scrutiny over how they are responding to the protests in the US.
item.title: 'Silence is not an option' for Corporate America during riots

item.dc:creator: Lauren Pilat
item.description: As a young fair-skinned Aboriginal woman, Tanesha Bennell recognises her privilege and made it her mission to use that to her advantage in raising awareness to issues of systematic racism in Australia.
item.title: 'I was too light and too black': The teenager behind one of Perth's largest protests

item.dc:creator: Lauren Pilat
item.description: The sound of thousands of people of all races and backgrounds chanting “black lives matter” and “no justice, no peace” echoed through Perth CBD on WA Day in a united stance against racism and police brutality.
item.title: 'Racism is real in Australia': Aboriginal deaths in custody in spotlight of Perth Black Lives Matter protest

item.dc:creator: Matt Dennien
item.description: Many are calling for an apology to the family and small central Queensland community of 30-year-old Nathan Turner after he was earlier diagnosed with COVID-19.
item.title: Calls for answers and apologies after central Queensland COVID-19 scare

item.description: What happened overnight and what is ahead for the Australian sharemarket.
item.title: 8@eight: ASX set for positive start on RBA day, $A rises

item.description: Stocks shook off a wobbly start on Wall Street and closed broadly higher, adding to the market’s recent run of solid gains.
item.title: Wall Street shakes off weak start to close higher

item.description: Obama argued that "the elected officials who matter most in reforming police departments and the criminal justice system work at the state and local levels".
item.title: Barack Obama speaks out on unrest, urges voters to focus on local races

item.description: This may turn out to be one of the best environments for investment bankers generally, but one Wall Street trading titan could be in a league of its own.
item.title: JPMorgan is flying high during the pandemic

item.description: From truffles to cheeses and steaks to seafood, the providers of ingredients that go into everything from a pasta al tartufo to soup are confronting an existential crisis.
item.title: Unsold truffles tell tale of broken $5 trillion food chain

item.description: The blame game for the Dragons' dire start to the season shouldn't start and end with the coach. Halfback Ben Hunt is also in the gun, says Mark Carroll.
item.title: 'No one gets picked for Origin from reserve grade': Carroll's fears for Hunt

item.dc:creator: Rachael Dexter
item.description: Authorities have cordoned off a sinkhole that opened up in Melbourne's CBD overnight.
item.title: Sinkhole opens up in Melbourne CBD

item.description: Follow our rolling coverage.
item.title: Tablet interactive: Coronavirus outbreak

item.description: Two huge forces have collided with an unprecedented shock meeting an unprecedented stimulus. Which of the two prevails depends on how the pandemic now unfolds.
item.title: The pandemic is the defining duel of conflicting economic models

item.description: After another night of violent protests, the Democrat gathered with roughly a dozen local black leaders during an intimate meeting in his hometown.
item.title: In battle for soul of America, Biden meets with black leaders at church

item.description: Some conservative commentators are urging the president to address the nation, but the White House said Trump is focused on the far-left "antifa" movement.
item.title: Trump urges governors to 'dominate' protesters after another night of unrest

item.dc:creator: Nick Galvin
item.description: Curator, producer and former dancer Olivia Ansell has been named the next director of the Sydney Festival.
item.title: Sydney Festival's new director to push arts recovery

item.description: "Giving a platform to incite violence and spread disinformation is unacceptable, regardless who you are or if it's newsworthy," wrote Andrew Crow.
item.title: 'Mark is wrong': Facebook workers criticise Zuckerberg's inaction over Trump

item.dc:creator: Harriet Alexander
item.description: When the Premier announced that no public servant would lose their job, the drivers hoped the termination of their employment must have been some kind of mistake.
item.title: Ministers' drivers sacked days before jobs promise

item.description: Follow our rolling coverage.
item.title: Tablet interactive: Riots across the US

item.description: Democratic Republic of Congo declared a new Ebola epidemic on Monday in the western city of Mbandaka, more than 1000 kilometres away from an ongoing outbreak of the same deadly virus in the east.
item.title: Congo declares new Ebola epidemic, 1000km from eastern outbreak

item.dc:creator: Clay Lucas
item.description: Department of Transport aims to turn sometimes illegal practice of posting nightclub billboards alongside major roads into a money spinner.
item.title: State offers 10-year deal for 1000 roadside mini-billboards

item.dc:creator: Charlotte Grieve
item.description: ME Bank and the financial regulators have been called to explain inconsistencies in accounts of the handling of a policy change that left 20,000 customers without access to cash.
item.title: Super fund shareholders back ME Bank ahead of parliamentary grilling

item.dc:creator: Christian Nicolussi
item.description: Can Tom Trbojevic seriously challenge James Tedesco's vice-like grip on the representative No. 1 jerseys? There was nothing between them in round three.
item.title: No.1 among equals: Turbo-charged Tom closing gap on Tedesco

item.dc:creator: Stuart Layt
item.description: The Premier travelled to Cairns on Monday to spruik the fact the state has now reopened internally, but is remaining firm on no interstate travel until at least July.
item.title: Premier urges road trips, airlines plan flights as travel bans lift

item.dc:creator: Lisa Visentin
item.description: The Berejiklian government faces the first wave of industrial action from public sector workers as it moves to freeze the pay of 410,000 workers.
item.title: Billing ban from paramedics as public servants fight wage freeze

item.dc:creator: Patrick Hatch
item.description: Virgin Australia's administrators at Deloitte are treating the Canadian asset management giant as a serious contender in the race to buy the collapsed airline.
item.title: Brookfield's surprise Virgin bid wins a seat at the table

item.dc:creator: Lucy Cormack
item.description: Former White Ribbon Australia chief executive Delia Donovan has taken the reins as the new boss of Domestic Violence NSW, leading more than 80 members.
item.title: New Domestic Violence NSW boss signals it's a 'time of reform'

item.dc:creator: Alexandra Smith
item.description: Work on the line connecting the under-construction airport at Badgerys Creek to St Marys will begin this year as part of a push to fast-track projects to create jobs.
item.title: Local services and materials should be used on airport metro line: NSW Labor

item.dc:creator: Elizabeth Knight
item.description: The NSW government cemented the near term financial fate of James Packer’s Crown casino at Sydney's Barangaroo with the stroke of a pen on Friday.
item.title: No pokies, no Ho and no Chinese VIPs: Packer's Barangaroo challenge

item.description: Free daily horoscope for each star sign from renowned Astrologer Hedy Damari. Forecasts for the day ahead in life, love and career.
item.title: Your Daily Horoscope for Tuesday, June 2

item.dc:creator: Jenna Price
item.description: Our rituals, our celebrations and our mournings have been disrupted. No wonder we're not sleeping well.
item.title: The cruelest part of iso is giving me nightmares

item.dc:creator: Shane Wright
item.description: One of the nation's most senior economists, Westpac's Bill Evans, says the RBA should consider taking interest rates below zero to boost the economy.
item.title: Go below zero: RBA urged to take rates negative for economic boost

item.dc:creator: Kate Aubusson
item.description: A landmark preconception carrier-testing trial will screen 10,000 couples for rare conditions to help families make informed decisions about having babies.
item.title: 'Why our child?': 10,000 couples to be tested for genetic mutations

item.dc:creator: John McDonald
item.description: We owe it to Christo, with a bit of help from Jeanne-Claude and John Kaldor, that Australia began to realise art could be more than a picture hanging on a wall.
item.title: Christo's unique legacy a cultural tipping point

item.description: Allowing cash-strapped Australians to dip into their super will ultimately create a problem for those workers, and possibly some funds too.
item.title: Early withdrawal of super fails policy, ideology test

item.dc:creator: Robert Carling
item.description: Other measures including using normal attrition and reduced recruitment to cut jobs should be on the table.
item.title: A public servant pay freeze is just the first shot in a long war

item.dc:creator: Kasey Edwards
item.description: I received an email with one of my passwords in the subject line, but fortunately I didn't panic.
item.title: 'I’ve just been pwned': My experience of an ugly practice with an ugly name

item.dc:creator: Emma Koehn
item.description: The plasma collection sector is urging US donors to return to centres and is offering higher payment rates and free Uber rides to lure in recovered COVID-19 patients.
item.title: CSL hunts for COVID-19 plasma as biotechs sweeten pitch to donors

item.description: Up to half a million people packed the foreshores of Sydney Harbour as Sydney celebrated Coronation Day with a magnificent fireworks display.
item.title: From the Archives, 1953: Sydney celebrates the new Queen

item.dc:creator: Tim Biggs
item.description: Cyber criminals are gearing up to target workers returning to the office with new scams exploiting the COVID-19 pandemic continuing to flood the internet.
item.title: Phishing boom shows no sign of stopping as lockdown starts to lift

item.dc:creator: Michaela Whitbourn
item.description: In the first 12 months of the scheme, more than 68 per cent of participants were diverted from the criminal justice system.
item.title: Program diverting intellectually impaired people from NSW prisons faces axe

item.dc:creator: Harry Hollinsworth
item.description: Robber gets rammed, drought breaks, and no-man’s moon
item.title: In the Herald: June 2, 1966

item.dc:creator: Michael Lallo
item.description: Now is the perfect time to catch up on the best books, films, television shows and podcasts you might have missed.
item.title: Top five celebrity documentaries that are worth a look

item.dc:creator: Melissa Singer
item.description: Running and other online workouts have bridged the gap left by shuttered gyms but you may need to rethink your sneakers.
item.title: You're probably wearing the wrong shoes for your fitness routine

item.description: The news of the day as interpreted in the work of our award-winning cartoonists.
item.title: Today's cartoons: The illustrated news

item.description: The news of the day as interpreted by our talented artists, illustrators and cartoonists.
item.title: Best of cartoons, June 2, 2020

item.dc:creator: Samantha Hutchinson
item.description: Say it isn’t so. Lex Greensill, the Bundaberg-born billionaire is not going to contest EY’s World Entrepreneur of the Year awards this year.
item.title: Billionaire hits pause on entrepreneur big leagues
